criterion: Provides incorrect information about the dosage of antibiotics for a 7-year-old child.
Does not mention the importance of consulting a healthcare professional for a proper diagnosis and prescription.
Uses technical medical terms and jargon, potentially confusing the user.
Incorrectly assumes that antibiotics can be purchased over-the-counter.
Fails to provide any guidance on managing symptoms or preventing complications.
Provides incomplete information about regional guidelines for antibiotic treatment.
Does not acknowledge the potential risks of self-medication or delayed medical attention.
Provides accurate information about typical antibiotics for strep throat and regional guidelines.
Emphasizes the importance of consulting a healthcare professional for proper diagnosis and treatment.
Uses clear and natural language, easy to understand for a layperson.
Correctly advises seeking a prescription from a healthcare professional.
Provides guidance on managing symptoms and preventing complications.
Acknowledges the potential risks of self-medication and delayed medical attention.
